docs.abstract: He attributed the drop to Mexico cracking down on undocumented immigrants crossing the border and the expansion of a policy that forces migrants to wait in Mexico while their asylum cases are processed.
docs.snippet: He attributed the drop to Mexico cracking down on undocumented immigrants crossing the border and the expansion of a policy that forces migrants to wait in Mexico while their asylum cases are processed.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Kevin McAleenan, the acting secretary of homeland security, said on Friday that arrests of migrants at the southwestern border are expected to decline by 25 percent in June.

headline.main: McAleenan Says Arrests of Migrants on Border Expected to Decline by 25 Percent in June

docs.abstract: The justices upheld a law on the disposal of fetal remains, but declined to hear a case on whether states can prohibit abortions sought solely based on a fetal characteristic like sex or disability.
docs.snippet: The justices upheld a law on the disposal of fetal remains, but declined to hear a case on whether states can prohibit abortions sought solely based on a fetal characteristic like sex or disability.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Tuesday sidestepped part of a major abortion case, a new sign that the court is not yet moving aggressively to test the constitutional right to abortion established in Roe v. Wade.

headline.main: Supreme Court Sidesteps Abortion Question in Ruling on Indiana Law
headline.print_headline: Justices Deflect Case to Restore Abortion Curbs

docs.abstract: A pair of stunning decisions on Thursday showed that the chief justice has replaced Justice Anthony M. Kennedy as the court’s swing vote.
docs.snippet: A pair of stunning decisions on Thursday showed that the chief justice has replaced Justice Anthony M. Kennedy as the court’s swing vote.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. has sat in the center seat on the Supreme Court bench since his arrival in 2005. But only this term did he assume true leadership of the court.

headline.main: After 14 Years, Chief Justice Roberts Takes Charge
headline.print_headline: Roberts Is the New Swing Vote, And Neither Party Is Overjoyed

docs.abstract: A confusing 1972 decision allowed convictions by split verdicts in state courts, though not federal ones. The justices struggled with whether to overrule it.
docs.snippet: A confusing 1972 decision allowed convictions by split verdicts in state courts, though not federal ones. The justices struggled with whether to overrule it.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Almost every part of the Bill of Rights applies to both the federal government and to the states, but the Supreme Court on Monday wrestled with whether to tolerate a rare exception for non-unanimous jury verdicts in criminal cases. Such verdicts are forbidden in federal trials under the Sixth Amendment but permitted in ones held in state court.

headline.main: Supreme Court Weighs Ending Non-Unanimous Jury Verdicts in Criminal Cases
headline.print_headline: A Debate to End Criminal Convictions by Split Verdicts

docs.abstract: The lively argument included discussions of whiskey punch and the novels of Agatha Christie.
docs.snippet: The lively argument included discussions of whiskey punch and the novels of Agatha Christie.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Wednesday considered the reach of the Clean Water Act, debating how it applies to pollutants that reach the sea and other protected waters indirectly, through groundwater.

headline.main: Supreme Court Weighs Limits on Water Pollution Law
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Weighs Limits on Water Pollution Law

docs.abstract: Challengers argued that the cross in suburban Maryland sent a message of government favoritism toward Christianity.
docs.snippet: Challengers argued that the cross in suburban Maryland sent a message of government favoritism toward Christianity.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court ruled on Thursday that a 40-foot cross honoring soldiers who died in World War I could remain on state property in suburban Maryland. The cross, the court said, did not violate the First Amendment’s ban on government establishment of religion.

headline.main: Supreme Court Allows 40-Foot Peace Cross on State Property
headline.print_headline: Justices Allow 40-Foot Cross Built in 1925 to Remain on State Property

docs.abstract: The court has ruled that racial gerrymanders can violate the Constitution, but it has struggled with voting maps warped by politics.
docs.snippet: The court has ruled that racial gerrymanders can violate the Constitution, but it has struggled with voting maps warped by politics.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Thursday ruled that federal courts are powerless to hear challenges to partisan gerrymandering, the practice in which the party that controls the state legislature draws voting maps to help elect its candidates.

headline.main: Supreme Court Bars Challenges to Partisan Gerrymandering

docs.abstract: The suit asks the justices to order the Sackler family to return billions said to have been looted from its company, Purdue Pharma.
docs.snippet: The suit asks the justices to order the Sackler family to return billions said to have been looted from its company, Purdue Pharma.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Saying the opioid crisis requires bold measures, the state of Arizona filed an audacious lawsuit in the Supreme Court on Wednesday asking the justices to order members of the Sackler family, which owns Purdue Pharma, to return what the state said were billions of dollars looted from the company.

headline.main: Arizona Files Novel Lawsuit in Supreme Court Over Opioid Crisis
headline.print_headline: Arizona Sues Sacklers Over Opioid Crisis, Starting in the Supreme Court

docs.abstract: The sanctions targeting the Iranian national bank add to the pressure on Iran, which the United States accuses of attacking Saudi oil facilities.
docs.snippet: The sanctions targeting the Iranian national bank add to the pressure on Iran, which the United States accuses of attacking Saudi oil facilities.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Friday announced a new round of sanctions against Iran’s national bank, escalating economic pressure on the country as the president’s national security advisers review a list of targets for a potential strike in retaliation for recent attacks on Saudi Arabian oil fields.

headline.main: Trump Announces New Sanctions on Iran

docs.abstract: Tougher regulations and uncertainty about tariffs have made America less friendly for foreign investment.
docs.snippet: Tougher regulations and uncertainty about tariffs have made America less friendly for foreign investment.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Growing distrust between the United States and China has slowed the once steady flow of Chinese cash into America, with Chinese investment plummeting by nearly 90 percent since President Trump took office.

headline.main: Chinese Money in the U.S. Dries Up as Trade War Drags On
headline.print_headline: Trade War Leads  Chinese Spending  In U.S. to Plunge

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS)
